remarks: For any set-like well-ordered class, there is an isomorphic ordinal number called its order type.  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 17-Oct-2009.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)
statement:
oicl.1 $e |- F = OrdIso ( R , A ) $.
ordtype $p |- ( ( R We A /\ R Se A ) -> F Isom _E , R ( dom F , A ) ) $.
